TopicTitle: Anyone crossing fingers for a RAPIER redesign?

Articles.Content: Personally have never been a huge fan of their look (although they fit with the chunkier rocket aesthetic) and am kind of hoping they get a cooler look soon, maybe with the nozzles a bit more exposed or something. Anyone else thinking the same?
No, I don't see that happening. They're fairly new and there are many other parts and other things to do before anything like that is even worth considering. Plus I rather like their design.

Wishing myself for a big power up or a bigger dual-mode engine. Trying to make at least a suborbital spaceplane in RSS is not easy with the current engines available (design based on Skylon, which uses SABRE engines having >2MN thrust)

Yeah, the RAPIER looks pretty bad and I would love to see it refreshed.

Step 1: Attach a pre-cooler to your plane

Step 2: Attach a shock-cone intake to the precooler (shock-cones have much less drag than rams)

Step 3: Attach an LVN to the pre-cooler's attach node

Step 4: Attach a cubic octagonal strut anywhere to the pre-cooler

Step 5: Attach a Turbojet to the cubic octagonal strut

Step 6: Slide and rotate into place, behind the LVN

Step 7: Repeat steps 4 to 6 for the RAPIER, Aerospike, and ION engine

Step 8: Enjoy your newly designed RAPIER, which is now a multi-mode all-in-one engine
